definition: Shi Hu
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: I appreciate Shihu's works of art very much.
sentences.chinese: 我十分欣赏石虎的艺术作品。

definition: Shi Le, founder of Later Zhao of the Sixteen Kingdoms 後趙|后赵 (319-350)
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Huan Xuan (369-404), general involved in the break-up of Eastern Jin
Dong Zhuo (-192), top general of late Han, usurped power in 189, murdered empress dowager and child emperor, killed in 192 by Lü Bu 呂布|吕布
Li Yuanhao (1003-1048), founding king of Xixia 西夏[Xi1 Xia4] around modern Ningxia 寧夏|宁夏[Ning2 xia4]
Wang Shichong (-621), general of late Sui and opponent of early Tang
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
An Lushan (703-757), Tang general, leader of the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Later Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (384-409)
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Qin Ershi (229-207 BC), second Qin emperor
Eastern Wei of the Northern dynasties (534-550), formed from the break-up of Wei of the Northern Dynasties 北魏
Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
Later Zhao of the Sixteen Kingdoms (319-350)
